verses.text: Not unto us, O \sc Lord\sc*, not unto us, But unto thy name give glory, For thy mercy, \add and\add* for thy truth’s sake.
Wherefore should the heathen say, Where \add is\add* now their God?
But our God \add is\add* in the heavens: He hath done whatsoever he pleased.
Their idols \add are\add* silver and gold, The work of men’s hands.
They have mouths, but they speak not: Eyes have they, but they see not:
They have ears, but they hear not: Noses have they, but they smell not:
They \add have\add* hands, but they handle not: Feet \add have\add* they, but they walk not: Neither speak they through their throat.
They that make them are like unto them; \add So is\add* every one that trusteth in them.
O Israel, trust thou in the \sc Lord\sc*: He \add is\add* their help and their shield.
O house of Aaron, trust in the \sc Lord\sc*: He \add is\add* their help and their shield.
Ye that fear the \sc Lord\sc*, trust in the \sc Lord\sc*: He \add is\add* their help and their shield.
The \sc Lord\sc* hath been mindful of us: he will bless \add us;\add* He will bless the house of Israel; He will bless the house of Aaron.
He will bless them that fear the \sc Lord\sc*, \add Both\add* small and great.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall increase you more and more, You and your children.
You \add are\add* blessed of the \sc Lord\sc* Which made heaven and earth.
The heaven, \add even\add* the heavens, \add are\add* the \sc Lord’s\sc*: But the earth hath he given to the children of men.
The dead praise not the \sc Lord\sc*, Neither any that go down into silence.
But we will bless the \sc Lord\sc* From this time forth and for evermore. Praise the \sc Lord\sc*.
